Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2013 12:53PM LoriIB wrote: Thank you for replying. It has been a month -- does swelling last that long? I have an appointment on July 30th with my surgeon. Everytime I feel this area (cord-like string) I am afraid that it is going to turn into something else. I have read that simple biopsy should not cause any deformity to the breast. Most noticable when I raise my arms up over my head.
Posts.Title: Post Core Needle Biopsy and arm pain candi07 LoriIB

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2013 09:42PM LoriIB wrote: Hi, I had a simple biopsy in my left breast in the upper corner. When I took off the tape I noticed a long line/indent going down the side of my breast. It looks like my breast is deformed. Is this normal? I was also diagnosed with ALH, which I will now need surgery to remove. The line/indent feels like there is a string where the indent is.Â  I have read that simple biopsy are not supposed to cause any deformity. If this occurred with a simple biopsy what will happen then I have surgery! Did anyone experience this with a needle biopsy. They told me that the ALH is not cancerous.
Posts.Title: Post Core Needle Biopsy and arm pain candi07 LoriIB
